item.title: Variational Auto-Encoder
item.description: Introduction We assume the observed variable \(x\) is a random sample from an unknown underlying process, whose true distribution \(p^*(x)\) is unknown. We attempt to approximate this underlying process with a chosen model \(p_{\theta}(x)\), with parameters \(\theta\): \[x\sim p_{\theta}(x)\] We always talk about learning like Deep Learning, and actually the learning is the process of searching for a value of the parameters \(\theta\) in model \(p_{\theta}(x)\), which can approximate the true distribution of the data, denoted by \(p^*(x)\).
